conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for checking in.

1) We are not holding the place under a formal offer to any family at the moment. However, while we still have an open place, we must continue to follow our admissions priority order and remain open to potential applications from higher-priority families.

2) If, in a later round, we reach a point where no higher-priority applications are pending/arriving and the place is still unfilled, we would be able to reconsider your candidacy at that time. The best way to stay active is to continue checking in and, if the place remains available, submit an [APPLY] again in a subsequent round.

We appreciate your patience and your clear commitment to Nursery_C.

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_C Admissions Team, [TALK]

Thank you again for your continued time.

Since the place is still unfilled, I wanted to ask one clarifying question so I can respond appropriately in the next round:

- What specific condition would allow you to extend an offer to me (e.g., if no higher-priority family has initiated contact/applied by a certain point in the round, or after a set number of rounds with no new higher-priority applications)?

Nursery_C remains my first choice, and if you are able to offer me the place at any point, I can accept immediately and complete all paperwork the same day.

Sincerely,
Parent_E
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_C remains available and it is my top true preference. I have been repeatedly rejected due to their priority order, so a direct [APPLY] is unlikely to change the outcome. To maximize my chance while staying active, I will send a [TALK] message that (a) reiterates immediate-acceptance commitment, (b) asks what concrete condition would trigger an offer to me, and (c) requests they fill the seat promptly if no higher-priority applicants are actually engaging. This keeps me in consideration without wasting an [APPLY] that they have consistently rejected for policy reasons.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your patience and for the clear question.

Because we must follow our admissions priority order, the only condition under which we could extend an offer to you is: **in a given round, we have an open place and we have not received (and are not considering) an [APPLY] from any higher-priority family than you for that place.** If that condition is met, we can make an offer to you immediately.

Two important clarifications:
- We **cannot commit to a fixed “number of rounds”** after which we automatically offer, because a higher-priority application could still arrive in a later round.
- Within a round, we also can’t promise an offer “by a certain point in the round,” since we only see who applies when messages arrive that round.

Practically, the best way to remain eligible is exactly what you’ve been doing: if you are still interested, please continue to send an **[APPLY]** in any round you want to be considered. In any round where no higher-priority [APPLY] is received for the remaining place, we would be able to move forward with you.

Sincerely,
